title: System dependencies register.
introduction: The dependencies register helps to control and manage third party dependencies.

astroid.desc: Enhanced AST for pylint and other projects.
astroid.notes: Required by PyLint, also used for other Python AST static analysis.

baron.desc: Full Syntax Tree for python to make writing refactoring code a realist task.
baron.notes: Required by redbaron, used for python static analysis and refactoring.

bashplotlib.notes: Used to plot stuff in the terminal.

beautiful_soup.desc: Beautiful Soup sits atop an HTML or XML parser, providing Pythonic idioms for iterating, searching, and modifying the parse tree.

bidict.desc: Efficient, Pythonic bidirectional map implementation and related functionality.

boltons.notes: A rather useful library used for a variety of different tasks.

bottle.desc: A fast and simple micro-framework for python web applications.
bottle.notes: Used to serve documentation, test results and reports.

bunch.desc: A Python dict providing attribute-style access.
bunch.notes: Used to make config object access more legible.

click.notes: Used to parse command line args for da.

cloudpickle.desc: Extended pickling support for Python objects.
cloudpickle.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

cmake.desc: A cross platform open source build system generator.
cmake.notes: Required to build LAPACK for NumPy.

colorama.notes: Required by radon. Used to display cyclomatic complexity measures.

cookiecutter.desc: A command-line utility that creates projects from templates.
cookiecutter.notes: Used to quickly create projects for counterparties.

coverage.notes: Used to calculate test coverage metrics.

cymem.desc: Manage calls to calloc/free through Cython.
cymem.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

cython.notes: Used to improve Python model runtime performance.

docutils.desc: Tools for processing plaintext documentation to HTML.

figleaf.desc: A code coverage recording and analysis package for Python.
figleaf.notes: Used to calculate test coverage metrics.

fuzzywuzzy.desc: A python module to perform fuzzy string matching.
fuzzywuzzy.notes: Used by the QMS to find build configuration files given partially matching query strings.

gitdb.desc: Python module to perform IO on git-style object databases.

gitpython.desc: Python module to interact with Git repositories.
gitpython.notes: Used to interface with source document repositories.

h5py.desc: A Pythonic interface to the HDF5 binary data format.
h5py.notes: Used to read segmentations done by ilastik.

html5lib_python.desc: HTML parser based on the WHATWG HTML specification.
html5lib_python.notes: Used as part of the engineering document compilation pipeline.

hyperopt.desc: Distributed Asynchronous Hyperparameter Optimization in Python.

hypothesis.desc: Hypothesis is an advanced Quickcheck style testing library for Python.
hypothesis.notes: Used to generate test cases based on assertions.

jdcal.desc: A library to handle Julian dates stored as two numbers.
jdcal.notes: Required by openpyxl for generating Excel format reports.

jinja2.desc: Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python.

lazy_object_proxy.desc: A fast and thorough lazy object proxy.
lazy_object_proxy.notes: Required by astroid and PyLint. Used for static analysis using the Python AST.

libxml2.desc: The XML C parser and toolkit of Gnome
libxml2.notes: Required by lxml. Used to generate reports and documentation.

lxml.desc: The lxml XML toolkit for Python.
lxml.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation. Needs libxml2

mando.desc: Create Python CLI apps with little to no effort at all.
mando.notes: Required by radon. Used to measure cyclomatic complexity.

markupsafe.desc: Implements a unicode subclass that supports HTML strings.

metaopt.desc: MetaOpt optimizes black-box functions in parallel.

murmurhash.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

networkx.desc: A Python package for studying complex networks.

numpy.notes: Required by many of our scientific computing dependencies.

openpyxl.desc: A Python library to read and write Excel 2007 files.

pathlib.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

pep257.desc: A static analysis tool for checking docstring style.
pep257.notes: Used for style-checking Python language source documents.

pep8.notes: Used for style-checking Python language source documents.

pillow.notes: Used for image processing in Python.

pip.desc: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
pip.notes: Required by metaopt setup script to parse requirements files.

plac.desc: The smartest command line arguments parser in the world.
plac.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

pluggy.desc: Plugin management and hook calling for Python.

preshed.desc: Cython hash table for pre-hashed keys.
preshed.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

pudb.desc: A console-based visual debugger for Python.

py.desc: The py lib is a Python development support library.
py.notes: Used by py.test to support unit testing.

py_gfm.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

py_good.notes: Used to verify design data and metadata against defined schema.

pycallgraph.desc: Create call graphs for Python programs.
pycallgraph.notes: Used to generate call graphs to help navigate and visualise program structure.

pycodestyle.notes: Formerly called pep8. Used for static analysis of design documents written in Python.

pydocstyle.notes: Formerly called pep256. Used for static analysis of design documents written in Python.

pygments.desc: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.
pygments.notes: Required by pudb. Used for debugging.

pylint.desc: A Python static analysis and testing tool.
pylint.notes: Used for static analysis and testing of design documents written in the Python language.

pymongo.notes: Used by hyperopt for inter process communication.

pymutester.desc: A tool to facilitate mutation testing in Python.
pymutester.notes: Used to check sufficiency of test coverage.

pyrun2.notes: Used to ensure consistent behaviour in the build.

pyrun3.notes: Used to ensure consistent behaviour in the build.

pyservice.desc: A simple library to make services on python more easily.
pyservice.notes: Intended to be used for build progress monitoring daemons.

pystache.notes: Required by pycco. Used to generate HTML documentation.

pytest.desc: A powerful and elegant python test framework.
pytest.notes: Intended to be used to run unit tests.

pytest_bdd.desc: BDD library for the py.test runner.
pytest_bdd.notes: Intended to be used to run BDD style unit tests.

pytest_cov.notes: Intended to be used to check test coverage levels.

pytest_json.desc: Generate json reports from pytest runs.
pytest_json.notes: Intended to be used to help report test results.

python_docx.desc: Create and modify Word documents with Python.
python_docx.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

python_docx_template.desc: Use a docx as a jinja2 template.
python_docx_template.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

python_markdown.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

radon.desc: Various code metrics for Python code.
radon.notes: Intended to be used to measure cyclomatic complexity and other metrics.

redbaron.desc: Abstraction on top of baron, a FST for python to make writing refactoring code a realistic task.
redbaron.notes: Used for python refactoring and code generation.

requests.desc: A Python package for studying complex networks.

robotframework.notes: Used for Acceptance Test Driven Development.

ruamel_yaml.desc: A YAML parser and emitter that supports roundtrip conversion.
ruamel_yaml.notes: Used to obtain line numbers for tracing the origin of embedded YAML metadata.

semver.desc: A python module for semantic versioning.
semver.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

simpy.notes: A framework for MIL and SIL simulations.

six.desc: Six is a Python 2 and 3 compatibility library.
six.notes: Required by PyLint. Used to run static testing.

setuptools.desc: Extensions to the distutils for large or complex distributions.
setuptools.notes: Many of our python library dependencies require setuptools to build.

smmap.notes: Required by gitpython. Used to interface with source document repositories.

snowballstemmer.desc: Snowball stemming library collection for Python.

spacy.notes: Used to improve the quality of requirements.

sphinx.notes: Required to build documentation for many dependencies.

sputnik.desc: Extended pickling support for Python objects.
sputnik.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

sqlitedict.desc: A persistent dict, backed-up by SQLite and pickle.

subl.desc: Sublime Text - A text editor that can be automated using Python.
subl.notes: Used for general purpose text editing.

tblib.desc: Traceback fiddling library. Allows you to pickle tracebacks.
tblib.notes: Used so we can throw exceptions across process boundaries.

thinc.desc: Learn super-sparse multi-class models in Cython.
thinc.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

transcrypt.notes: Used to develop client-side code in Python.

treelib.desc: Tree implementation in python: simple to use for you.

ultrajson.desc: Ultra fast JSON encoder and decoder for Python.
ultrajson.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

urwid.desc: Console user interface library for Python.
urwid.notes: Required by pudb. Used for debugging.

voluptuous.notes: Used to verify design data and metadata against defined schema.

wrapt.desc: A Python module for decorators, wrappers and monkey patching.
wrapt.notes: Used by astroid, which is used by PyLint.

xenon.notes: Intended for use in checking complexity metrics.

yaml.desc: The next generation YAML parser and emitter for Python.
yaml.notes: Used to read and write YAML format configuration files. Currently built without support for libyaml
